January 19, 2025

Your First Blog Post

CloudTutorial

This is where your blog post content goes. Write in plain Markdown.

How to Write Posts

Create a new .md file in src/pages/blog/. The filename becomes the URL slug. For example, my-new-post.md becomes /blog/my-new-post.

Frontmatter

Every post needs this metadata at the top:

---
layout: ../../layouts/BlogPostLayout.astro
title: "Post Title"
description: "Brief description"
pubDate: 2025-01-20
tags: ["Tag1", "Tag2"]
---

Markdown Features

You can use all standard Markdown:

  • Bold text and italic text
  • Links
  • inline code
  • Lists (like this one)

Code Blocks

def hello():
    print("Hello, world!")

Blockquotes

This is a blockquote. Use it for callouts or quotes.

Images

Place images in public/images/ and reference them:

![Alt text](/images/my-image.png)

Delete this template and start writing your own posts!

If you found this useful, consider sharing it:

LinkedIn
